item.description:
Nothing seems to cause more controversy among Buddhists in America than talking about rebirth and reincarnation. If we have no self, what is reborn? If we do not believe in rebirth, what is the point of karma? Is the belief in rebirth just another form of attachment to self? How does reincarnation relate to the Shin belief in birth in the Pure Land? Rather than solving this problem, this talk will explore the Shin ways of framing the question. *The Japanese word bonpu means "foolish being". Presented by Kogen.

visit our web site at www.bffct.net
